name: Vietnam Family Adventure
summary: Gifted with a staggering abundance of flavourful food, fascinating culture, untouched nature, and disarmingly friendly people, Vietnam has more than earned its rep as one of the world’s most popular travel destinations. This fun-focused family trip packs as much of the good stuff into 12 days as humanly possible – including cruising Halong Bay, exploring the Imperial Citadel, and even a boat trip to a floating market – yet still offers more than enough time to relax. Don’t forget to pack your smile; you’ll be needing it often here.
highlights: Discover hidden gems in Hanoi's mazed old town
Stargaze on board a junk boat in Ha Long Bay
Explore the villages around Hoi An by bike
Chase fireflies in the Mekong Delta during a home stay

name: Authentic Vietnam tour for 12 days
summary:
Vietnam which is a beautiful country with breathless scenes along from North to South. Each of the places has a different prettiness. It's hard to find out anywhere which has all of the beauty: the majestic beauty of the mountain destination in the North such as Sapa or Halong; the peace with the ancient feature of Ninh Binh; the bustling of Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh; the rustic beauty of Hoian; or Idyllic beauty of Vietnamese,... All of them will be gathered in one Authentic Vietnam tour.


  Enjoy the wild beauty of Sapa - one of the best mountain provinces in Vietnam
  Explore the magnificent scenery of the World Heritage Site: Halong Bay
  Appreciate the ancient history, architecture, and culture of Vietnam in two famous Old towns : Hanoi Old Quater and Hoian
  Have a chance to immersed the life of a Vietnamese farmer
  Discover of one the marvelous tunnel which was used in the Vietnam war

timeline.title: Hanoi arrival ( no meal)
timeline.description:
Welcome up on arrival by Go Vietnam Travel‘s guide and driver, then we transfer to the hotel.

Relax after the long flight and overnight in Hanoi

A lot of amazing things are waiting for you in the next dat for a real authentic Vietnam tour.

timeline.title: Hanoi Tour – Overnight train to Sapa (B, L, and Welcome Dinner)
timeline.description:
First and foremost, Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam which has ancient and model Vietnam features. We spend time  our this day to know how authentic Vietnam tour is.
After breakfast today, we visit the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, His House on stilts, the One Pillar Pagoda, the outside of the Presidential Palace and the Temple of Literature which was Vietnam’s first University.
Having lunch and we get more Vietnam culture at the intriguing Ethnology Museum. Followed by an hour on a cyclo (a pedal rickshaw) being taken round the old quarter of Hanoi. Then we enjoy Welcome Dinner at nice restaurant in Hanoi. After that, we will come back hotel to take your luggage to transfer to train for overnight train to Sapa.
Overnight on Train.

timeline.title: Sapa - Y Linh Ho - Lao Chai - Ta Van (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Amazing Sapa sightseeing:
Arriving early to Lao Cai today we will transfer to Sapa for our trek, where we will enjoy spectacular scenery as we head to the Y Linh Ho village of the Hmong people. After lunch, we head to the Muong Hoa Valley, on the way passing through the villages of Lao Chai and Ta Van where we will have a chance to meet some of the locals.

Homestay experience:
Tonight we enjoy a homestay at one of the hill tribe villages. Homestays are a great way to get a feel for the culture and really understand more about the daily lives of the local people. A common saying is…  ‘you will arrive as a guest but leave as a friend’. Your overnight accommodation will be in a homestay in Sapa.
Overnight in Homestay Sapa.

timeline.title: Sapa – Bus back to Hanoi (B)
timeline.description:
This morning, we will visit Ham Rong Mountain – home to numerous kinds of flowers and orchard gardens. Wandering stone paths leads tourists to wild peach forest, then orchid gardens with more than 6000 orchid plants belonging to 194 kinds. Then a visit to Heaven Gate, the highest stretch of road in Vietnam as well as the provincial border of Lao Cai and Lai Chau provinces. Enjoy fantastic view over the valley! Then you can visit one more village in Sapa: Ma Tra or Ta Phin.
In the late morning, our tour guide and driver will take you back to Sapa Town for lunch. You will be free until our Limousine take you back to Hanoi city.

Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: Hanoi – Truly Ninh Binh (B, L)
timeline.description:
At 8.00 AM, say goodbye to Hanoi and spend two-hour drive to the South, Ninh Binh Province.

Mua Cave hiking:
On arrival, we have trekking time at Hang Mua (Mua Cave). Climbing up hundreds of steps, you will reach a temple on top of a hill and enjoy the spectacular views from Hang Mua over Tam Coc and Ninh Binh’s stunning countryside are well worth the effort.

Steps lead to Hang Mua was imitated from the architecture of the Great Wall of China with 486 stone steps. Traveling to Hang Mua, you will wallow in a wonderful landscape of mountain, valley and river.
Visit Hoa Lu acient citadel:
We will visit Hoa Lu, the former capital of Vietnam under Dinh and Le dynasty with two temples worshiping Dinh Tien Hoang King and Le Dai Hanh King. Dinh Tien Hoang had successfully defeated Ngo Dynasty and made Vietnam officially independent from any ruler. We then stop at a local restaurant for lunch.
Rowing on Trang An Eco-Tourism complex:
In the afternoon, we will take a pleasant boat rowing in Hoang Long River to visit Trang An Eco-Tourism complex. The complex is surrounded by picturesque landscape with thousands of hectares with more than 100 caves which can be explored by boat. It is also a home of 600 kinds of flora and over 200 kinds of fauna that many of them in the Red book of Vietnam. On the rowing boat, we can enjoy the fresh air, clean and clear water with under water grass. Experience ourselves the feeling and emotion when we are on the water caves.
Then we will come back to Hanoi capital.

Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: Hanoi – Halong Bay (Overnight on deluxe junk) (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Halong Transfer:
Upon arrival Hanoi, guide will pick up and take you to a day use hotel for relax and refresh. Then, our shuttle bus will pick up and transfer you to Halong Bay. Arrive at Tuan Chau harbour and refresh at the Oasis Bay Lounge for about 20 minutes before boarding. Transfer to cruise. Welcome drink, cruise briefing, safety instructions, and check-in cabins.

Special lunch will be served on board while passing by Dog islet, Fighting Cock islet (symbol of Halong Bay), Hoa Cuong fishing village, Swan islet. After having lunch, the Oasis Bay will continue exploring the wonders of Halong Bay.
Visit Ti Top island:
Hiking & swimming in emerald coloured water. In the late afternoon, we return to the main boat and continue cruising to the quiet area. In the late afternoon, we enjoy Sunset Party on sundeck and admire the best moments of the day when the sun starts to set. After dinner, free time for socializing with other guests, take part in board games, fish for squid, or just laze around. Overnight on board.

timeline.title: Halong Bay – Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description:
Get up early in the morning to enjoy fresh air of the bay and start the day with Tai Chi class. Coffee & tea with assorted homemade pastries, fresh juices. Relax or Visit Sung Sot Cave, hiking up and down 600 steps to the magnificent limestone formations of the most beautiful and biggest cave in Halong bay. Check-out cabins and settle bills. Relaxing time and cruising. The Lunch will be served while Oasis Bay is cruising back to the habor. Shuttle bus pick guest up at Oasis Bay Lounge. Our waiting vehicle will transfer us back to Hanoi.

Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Hanoi – Flight Danang – Hoian walking tour ( B/L/-)
timeline.description:
After your breakfast at hotel, our tour guide will pick you up and transfer to airport.

On your arrival in Danang, we will meet local tour guide and driver at the airport then move to hotel in Hoian. After lunch and short rest, we have a walking tour in Hoi An town – one of the World Culture Heritages of Vietnam. This quaint riverside town still boasts a wealth of century’s old traditional architecture. The influences of several Asian cultures can be seen in the old houses and waterside buildings. It is also famous as a place to be instantly created inexpensive tailored outfits.
Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Hoian – Farming & Fishing tour ( B/L/-)
timeline.description:
Local farming village:
This morning, we can choose bus or bike to cycle to a local farming village to join daily work life of local farmers – hoeing and a soil, watering veggie at an organic herb garden, riding water buffalo in the field and enjoy the freshest air of the countryside beauty. After that, board the Hoi An Eco-tour boat and cruise to the mouth of the river where it meets the Cua Dai Sea.

Coconut palm village:
We also learn and try our hand at local traditional fishing techniques using round and cast nets, learn to paddle the strange and unique Vietnamese bamboo basket boats. Explore the now tranquil coconut-palm flanked waterways of a past war and hear of the extreme conditions endured by soldiers on both sides. Have a relaxed fun with catching beautiful purple crabs on bamboo basket boat.
After visit a local water coconut palm village, we take a walk around the village and have some tea and snack with local talks…Back on-board our Hoi An Eco-tour boat, enjoy our lunch and cold beer or soft drink on boat, then back to hotel for our luggage packing.

Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch.

Overnight in Hoian

timeline.title: Hoi An – Fly to Ho Chi Minh city – Cu Chi Tunnel (B)
timeline.description:
We transfer back to Danang airport to take a short domestic flight to Ho Chi Minh city this morning. After 1 hour flight, we are welcome by local tour guide and driver in Ho Chi Minh city then transfer to hotel.

In the afternoon, we will leave Saigon for the Cu Chi tunnels, otherwise known as the “Iron Triangle” or “Iron Land”. On our way there we will drive through pleasant countryside; rubber plantations and rice paddies. Before entering the tunnels, we will see a short introductory video showing how they were constructed. Also on display are various mantraps and the remains of an American tank as well as numerous bomb craters made by 500lb bombs dropped by B52 bombers. After that we transfer back to Ho Chi Minh city.
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh

timeline.title: Ho Chi Minh city – Cai Be - Vinh Long - Ho Chi Minh (B)
timeline.description:
Sightseeing Mekong Delta:
Meet us at the pier in front of Cuu Long Hotel in Vinh Long where your crew will be ready to welcome you aboard with cold towels and a refreshing drink while the Cai Be Princess Sampan sets off for its leisurely cruise on the busy waterways of the Mekong Delta.

Explore Phu Dong Canal:
Crossing the Co Chien River, one of the original nine branches of the mighty Mekong in the Delta, enter the Dong Phu Canal. Cruise past the islands of An Binh and Binh Hoa Phuoc, famous for their fruit orchards. Observe from the comfort of your sampan life as it plays out on the riverbanks the people.

Visit an ancient house and local villages:
Continue cruising along narrow canals past rural, unspoiled landscapes and lush greenery while observing the activity along the banks. Visit an ancient house built in the 19th century. Continue towards Phu An Hamlet and stop in on local workshops to observe the traditional process of making coconut candy and puffed rice (the local equivalent of popcorn).
Have lunch:
Your cruise ends at Le Longanier Restaurant. Lunch is served in this exquisite colonial-style villa set in a lush tropical garden by the river and surrounded by fruit trees, giving you a sense of privileged life during Indochinese times. After lunch (at around 2:30 pm), take a short walk along a small canal back to Ba Bon Bridge where your personal vehicle awaits to drive you to Ho Chi Minh City.

Overnight in Ho Chi Minh.

timeline.title: Ho Chi Minh Departure (B/-/-)
timeline.description:
After your breakfast, we will start to move to airport. The guide say good bye to you.

Tour end.

name: Halong 3days/2nights tour on UniCharm Cruise 4*
summary:
The iconic image of Ha Long Bay's karst peaks jutting from the blue waters epitomises the unique and incredible beauty of Vietnam. The stunning scene has a mythical attractiveness which reflects its depiction in local folklore. According to the age-old tale, Ha Long Bay was created by the descent of a mother dragon that, along with her children, came to protect the bay against a fearsome invasion. 
It is said that the dragons spat emeralds from their mouths towards their enemies and that those jewels transformed into the jewel like islands and islets. It is from this legend that the area takes the name Ha Long Bay which translates as “Bay of the Descending Dragons”.

timeline.title: Day 01: Hanoi – Hai Phong – Cat Hai Island – Cat Ba Island – Halong Bay – Lan Ha Bay (Boating - Kayaking – Snorkeling – Swimming)
timeline.description:
AM: View Halong Bay from its back side


09:00 – 09:30 pick up at your hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter area or in front of Hanoi Opera House.


09:30 leave Hanoi for Hai Phong city on the free-way AH 5B enjoying the peaceful landscape of rice field of the Red river Delta. Enjoy driving on the longest sea passing bridge of Vietnam of which front is Cat Ba Island – Huge mountain scene and green mangroves.


11:30 arrival at the pier on Cat Hai Island where the river mouths meeting the sea with the local fishing boats are bustling out the sea and backwards ashore.


12:00 UniCharm crew warmly welcome you on board. Visit the boat and check in the room and lunch on boat (We can cater Vegetarian or vegan food on your request).
Enjoying the first fresh seafood lunch and cruising along the Mangrove of Cat Ba Island into the back of Halong Bay – Tuan Chau Island via Gia Luan gulf to Cap Bai Islet and then Ngon Tay Island (Finger Islet) where you can view the universal seascape of Halong Bay World Heritage such as Sung Sot Cave and Titop Island.


On the hidden route for different views of the bay, pass by Ao Ech lagoon (Frog Lagoon) to Ba Trai Dao (Three Peaches). We start discovering the most beautiful and peaceful bay called Lan Ha Bay, the bay with crystal water and round lagoons and the Hon Dua (the Stick Islet). The bay is the additional part of the Wonder of Halong Bay and the World Biosphere reserved area.


PM: Open the Hidden charm
Discover the additional part of the Wonder of Halong and the world Biosphere reserved area by kayaking and snorkeling.


On each 2-seat kayak we will paddle through narrow lanes of the Karst Mountains to visit fishing villages, call on some local fishing families to get to learn more about the daily life of the local fisherman.
Paddle to a stunning lagoon with tunnel grotto (depend on the tide, we may not be able to reach). Here we will dip into the emerald waters. Swimming and Snorkeling to see Corals are our highlight of this day. You can also reach some secluded beach for a while relaxing lying on sand….


Back to the boat for “cooking class” (our tour guide will show you how to make some famous Vietnamese traditional dishes that you can easily demonstrate home for your family after this trip).


Enjoy Dinner and overnight on the lovely peaceful bay once on your lifetime.

timeline.title: Day 02: Lan Ha Bay – Viet Hai village – Cat Ba National Park (Biking – Swimming – Boating)
timeline.description:
Wake up among the smooth waves and Karst Mountains and fishing villages.
Enjoy breakfast.


Tender ship to Cat Ba Island, reach Viet Hai dock for a bicycle trip to Viet Hai village. Riding a bike for 30 minutes on the shadowed paths, enjoying the landscape on the way to the village located in a beautiful valley of the National Park of Cat Ba. Visit some local house to get to know about the local people as well as their daily life of work or visit the island school…


Afterward cycling back to the Cruise.


Trekking and Swimming


Another small boat takes you to Cat Ba Island and then a car trip to the central of the Park


Visit the hospital cave where Vietnam Army used as the hospital during the war.


Spend 3 hours for trekking in the jungle. We trek up to Ngu Lam peak – the amazing view point for whole Cat Ba Island – Lan Ha Bay and Halong Bay.


Drive back to the town for lunch.


Check in hotel and stay one night in hotel on Cat Ba Island – free time & dinner on your own.


Option 2:  Drive to Beo dock then boat back to UniCharm Cruise for dinner and overnight on board.
(There will be surcharge for choosing this option)

timeline.title: Day 03: Cat Ba Island – Lan Ha Bay – Cat Hai Island – Hanoi
timeline.description:
AM: Cat Ba Island – Lan Ha Bay


Breakfast at the hotel.
Morning exercises by walking up to the Canon Fort where you will visit the old battle base with the ruin canons and the tunnels. Here you also obtain a big view to the bay and the sea mouth.


Boat back to UniCharm Cruise.
Spend for a while for swimming in the bay from the cruise and then fresh up on the cruise sundeck Cruising back to our starting place on another hidden route.
Cruising pass by the fishing villages and thousands of limestone islands and islets, taking precious Uni pictures and enjoying our tasteful lunch.


PM: Back to Hanoi – See off at your hotel


12:00 – 12:30 arrival back, say goodbye to the bay and disembark UniCharm Cruise for another free-way AH5B back to Hanoi. Estimated to arrive back in Hanoi at 15:30 – 16:00 – end the tour at your hotel.

name: Vietnam Highlights Package 21 days/20nights
summary: Are you still looking for that perfect trip to make a year to remember? Then look forward to this incredible almost three week tour around the stunning country of Vietnam! Fall in love with Vietnamese food, marvel at breathtaking landscapes and discover the rich and proud history of this incredible Southeast Asian nation.

timeline.description:
You land in Saigon, and this is where your adventure begins! You will be welcomed and taken from the airport by our representative to your selected hotel in Saigon. Free at leisure. Stay overnight in Saigon.
Distance: Tan Son Nhat Airport  Saigon Central: 7  8km -> 30 minute transfer
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

timeline.title: Day 2: Discover Saigon City (B, L)
timeline.description:
09.00 AM You pass by the now-demolished wartime American Embassy on our way to the Reunification Palace. This famous edifice was a former residence of the President of Southern Vietnam until end of April 1975. 
Close to the palace are some striking French colonial structures including the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Old Sai Gon Post Office. 
You follow these with a visit to the Jade Emperor Pagoda and the War Remnant Museum with a wealth of images from the notorious conflicts 
The sightseeing ends up with a walk around the retail Ben Thanh Market where everything is for sale.
Check in hotel and overnigh in Saigon
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

timeline.title: Day 3 4: Mekong Delta Cruise to visit Cai Be Market 2Days/1Night (2B, 1L)
timeline.description:
Mekong Delta River Life Style  where people dont use motorbike/cars much, but boats, where the people live, work and even entertain on river boat. Take this trip and youll have the chance to see the most interesting, exotic rural life in Vietnam with a boat ride on the Mekong Delta River. And Cai Be floating market is typical.
Stay overnight in Can Tho.
Here is the highlights of the trip that you will never forget:
Keep your eyes on the green paddy fields existing on the way to Mekong Delta River
Cai be floating market  one of the biggest and famoust floating market in Mekong, enjoy the peaceful moment of local rural life
Walk to visit Coconut Candy Farm, buy the hand-made items from coconut trees of Mekong Delta as souvenir.
After lunch at seasonal fruit garden, you will be divided from motorized boat group into some 2-pax groups on smaller sampan to do zigzag through a maze of shadow canals to enjoy the fresh air along the canals and water coconut trees scenery.
Cruising along the small and picturesque tributaries by rowing boat, we will see the biggest floating market in Can Tho Province  Cai Rang floating market (the nicest one with heaps of rowing boats).
Visit a rice husking mill and a rice noodles making shop.
Distance: Saigon - Vinh Long - Can tho: 420km/2days 
Iris Can Tho Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Saigon - Cuchi Tunel half day trip (B)
timeline.description:
This morning explore the amazing network of the Cu Chi Tunnels with length about 200km, which housed entire underground guerrilla villages during the American War in Vietnam.
Free for your own activities in the afternoon. Stay overnight in Saigon.

Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon or similar

timeline.title: Day 6: Ho Chi Minh City - Nha Trang by flight (B)
timeline.description:
Continue your trip with the next destination is our most beautiful sunny beach city  Nha Trang.
The afternoon is free at your leisure to stroll along the beach or explore this seaside town. Overnight in Nha Trang hotel.
Distance: Saigon - Nha Trang by 45 minutes of flight.
Cam Ranh Airport - Nha Trang city central 30km -> 45 minutes transfer
Nha Trang Regalia Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 7: Nha Trang Islands Tour (B, L)
timeline.description:
In the morning you will transfer to Cau Da port for a cruise on the Nha Trang Bay to visit Tri Nguyen Aquarium on Mieu Island to enjoy hundreds of nice and precious marine creatures then continue the trip to Mun Island -the best island for snorkeling with lots of lives colorful corals and fish. Taking a fresh lunch at the Con Se Tre island and relax. Back to hotel. Overnight in Nha Trang.
Nha Trang Regalia Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 8: Nha Trang Hoi An by flight (B)
timeline.description:
Leave Nha Trang to Hoi An - an ancient town of Quang Nam Province. This journey need the domestic flight from Nhatrang to Danang airport. Arrive in Danang, you will be greeted to transfer to: Marble mountain, Cham Museum, hotel in Hoi An for check-in. Stay overnight in Hoi An. Discover Hoi An ancient town by night. Distance: Danang airport - Hoi An town: 35 km -> 45 minutes transfer
Phu Thinh Resort Hoi An or similar

timeline.title: Day 9: Hoi An Cooking Class & Ancient Town Trip (B, L)
timeline.description:
In the morning, you will be welcomed by the Chef. Visit Hoi Ans colorful market, and experience the amazing sights, sounds and aromas of this busy market. Here, you will have the opportunity to interact with the local sellers and learn about all the ingredients to be used in the cooking lesson later. We board the boat for a leisurely cruise (25 minutes) along the Hoi An River to the Cooking School. This is a chance to view local river life, so make sure your camera is handy. On arrival, we explore the cooking schools herb garden, before learning about some of Hoi Ans and Vietnams well-known dishes. The cooking lesson runs for about 2 hours  the chefs first demonstrate each dish before we prepare the same dish ourselves. Included in the class is a brief introduction to Vietnamese food carving (plate decoration). After the lesson, we sit down and eat what we have cooked.
Then, The guide and driver met you when disembark boat to continue half day to explore Hoian town: the Japanese Covered Bridge-the symbol of Hoian. Step back in time to discover the Chinese street with stunning Phuc Kien Hall and Phung Hung old house typical of Hoian original architecture. We then visit Hoi An vibrant market and ancient port to explore the rythm of local daily life and savor the true color, flavor and taste of the oriental. Finally, we visit Phuc Thanh Pagoda  the oldest pagoda in Hoi An built in 1454 with Chinese bonze.
Check in hotel and overnight in Hoi An Ancient Town.
Phu Thinh Resort Hoi An or similar

timeline.title: Day 10: Hoi An - My Son Holly Land Visit (B)
timeline.description:
In the early morning, our guide and car will pick you up at your hotel for transfer to My Son Holy land- once the capital city of Champa Kingdom (around the 4th to 12th century). My Son is a large complex of religious relics that comprises more than 70 architectural works. They include temples and towers connecting to each other with complicated red brick designs. The major structure of Cham architecture is tower, built to reflect the divinity of the king. Drive back to Hoi An around noon.
Free in the afternoon. You could try some tailor-made Vietnamese Dress or shopping.
Overnight in Hoi An.
Distance: Hoi An town - My Son Holly Land: 50 km  1 hour transfer 
Phu Thinh Resort Hoi An or similar

timeline.title: Day 11: Hoi An Hue by Road (B)
timeline.description:
Our driver will pick you up at your hotel in Hoi An and drop you at your hotel in Hue. On the road, you will have chance to visit Vietnam’s famous spot  Hai Van Pass. Arrive in Hue, take the trip to visit the Formal Imperial City with famous sights as Imperial Citadel, Forbidden Puple City, Khai Dinh. Overnight in Hue. Distance: Hoi An town - Hue: 145 km -> 3 hours transfer
Hue Cherish Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 12: Hue - Hanoi by flight (B)
timeline.description:
After breakfast, take your morning trip to visit the Royal Tomb of Minh Mang and Thien My Pagoda by boat along the perfume river. After the trip, transfer to airport & take flight to Hanoi. Arrive Hanoi. Check in hotel & overnight in Hanoi.
Distance: Hue Central  Phu Bai Airport: 14 km  20 minutes transfer
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 13: Hanoi Sightseeing full day (B, L)
timeline.description:
Having breakfast at hotel then start sightseeing Hanoi, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards and public parks, is the capital of Vietnam. It is a very attractive city with French-style architecture. You have a full day of sightseeing ahead, including a visit to Hochiminh Mausoleum, One Pillar Pagoda, which was built by Ly Thai Tong and the Temple of Literature, founded by Emperor Ly Thanh Tong.
After lunch, stop in the heart of Hanoi at Hoan Kiem Lake, which contains an islet with a tiny Tortoise Pagoda.
Take the outside visit to the Opera House, St. Joseph Cathedral and make sure your camera is handy. Conclude with a visit to Bao Tang Lich, once the museum of lEcole Francaise dExtreme Orient, which includes artifacts from Vietnams turbulent history. Optional for Water Puppet Show, Cyclo visiting Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 14: Hanoi - Duong Lam Ancient Village (B, L)
timeline.description:
Today is such a peaceful day with the short trip to visit the most ancient village in the north of Vietnam  Duong Lam Village, well-known for its preserved ancient houses, some of which date back 400 years. Visit Mong Phu Temple in Mong Phu Hamlet and observe the daily lives of the locals. This evening watch a performance of the famous Water Puppets, which have a history dating back thousands of years.
Distance: Hanoi central  Duong Lam Village: 60 km -> 1.5 hours transfer
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi or similar

timeline.title: Day 15: Excursion to Halong Bay and Stay overnight on Board (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Early this morning, well drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone peaks or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. Well spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since were overnight on the water, well be able to explore Ha Long Bays most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat.
Distance: Hanoi central  Halong Bay: 180 km  3.5 hours transfer 
Garden Bay Cruises or similar

timeline.title: Day 16: Halong Bay Cruise - Hanoi - Lao Cai/Sapa by Overnight Train (B, L)
timeline.description:
Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay.
After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi for overnight. Arrive Hanoi at 3:00pm. Check in hotel & free time to go sightseeing in the Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.
Remark: The Halong itinerary is subject to change upon cruises management.
The great trip to Vietnam will be much interesting by extending to visit Sapa  northwest of Vietnams North.
7:30pm: Embark on train for the night trip to Lao Cai  Sapa. The cabin is based on 4-berth sharing cabin, overnight on train.
Distance: Hanoi central  Train Station: 3 km  10 minutes transfer
Livitrans Express Train, 4 Berths Cabin (Soft Sleeper) or similar

timeline.title: Day 17: Lao Cai Arrival - Sapa by Road - Homestay (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Arrive in Lao Cai Station early this morning. Be greeted at the train station, transferred to Sapa town.
Sapa is one of the most interesting sightseeing in the north of Vietnam, with the height around 1500-1650 m above sea level. Sapa is a land of modest, quietly but hides varies wonderful of natural scenes and Sapa is also a nest of hill tribe as: Black HMong, Red Dzao, Xa Pho, Tay, Zayetc. Travel to Sapa, people forget everything, just enjoy the fresh air, clouds, sky, romantic scenery, majestic place, that is the reason why Sapa town is also known as the town in the cloud. With an average temperature of 14-18C, cool in summer but a bit cold in winter. Sapa always attract tourists in whole year.
Arrive in Sapa around 9am, have a soft breakfast at local restaurant. The room for refresh/changing is confirmed upon availability. Otherwise you could book in advance with extra charge.
About 10:00 am we leave the hotel and start trekking. The first part is on the road but we soon turn to the right and walk on a small path down the valley to the Muong Hoa River and from here to the Black Hmong village Lao Chai. Black Hmong is one of the biggest minority groups in the Sapa area. They are proud of their culture and keep their traditions and way of living. They have their own language and wear traditional indigo blue clothing. After this you continue to Ta Van Village (1.200 m) to visit Zay people. Zay is a fairly small minority group of about 38.000 people who live mainly in the mountains in Northwest Vietnam. The development has meant that some of their old customs have been lost but many women still wear traditional shirts with a purple, blue or green color. The Zay houses are built of wood and bamboo with a clay floor. We stay overnight with a local family in Ta Van and have our dinner here.
Remark: if the homestay is not convenient for you, the hotel option is available with extra charge.
Distance: Lao Cai  Sapa: 30 km  45 minutes transfer
Homestay at the villages or Sapa Bamboo Hotel or similar

timeline.title: Day 18: Giang Ta Chai - Su Pan - Sapa - Night train to Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description:
After the breakfast we continue to visit Red Dzao people at Giang Ta Chai where we also see a waterfall. The Red Dzao women have very colorful red embroidery and coins on their clothing. On their head they wear a red scarf. Some of the women have shaved off their eyebrows because of a nice Red Zao Legend.
We continue along small paths in the rice fields, cross the Muong Hoa River and trek up to Su Pan where you will meet the jeep and transfer back to Sapa.
Evening take a transfer to Lao Cai station for a night train to Hanoi. Overnight on train based on 4-berth sharing cabin.
Livitrans Express Train, 4 Berths Cabin (Soft Sleeper) or similar
